title: Cost to Build a 5 Marla / 10 Marla / 1 Kanal House in Multan (Updated Guide)
excerpt: Building a home in Multan involves multiple cost factors such as grey structure, finishing materials, labor, design, and society requirements. This updated guide breaks down the complete cost to build a 5 Marla, 10 Marla, and 1 Kanal house in Multan, helping homeowners plan confidently and avoid unexpected expenses.
content:
Introduction: Understanding House Construction Costs in Multan

Multan is one of Pakistan’s fastest-growing cities, with new housing societies and modern homes being built at a rapid pace. Whether you plan to build a 5 Marla, 10 Marla, or 1 Kanal home, understanding the construction cost in advance is essential for proper budgeting. This guide provides an updated and accurate breakdown of material costs, labor charges, grey structure estimates, and finishing costs in Multan.

1. Factors That Affect House Construction Cost

The cost of building a house in Multan depends on several key elements:
- Grey structure materials
- Finishing materials and quality grade
- Labor costs
- Design and architectural fees
- Housing society bylaws
- Plot location and soil condition

Knowing these factors helps you plan your budget more realistically.

2. Cost to Build a 5 Marla House in Multan (Updated)

A standard 5 Marla house usually ranges between 1,900 to 2,200 square feet of covered area. Below is the cost breakdown:

Grey Structure Cost
The grey structure includes bricks, cement, steel, plumbing, wiring, and labor. In Multan, the updated grey structure cost for a 5 Marla house is approximately:
- PKR 3,200,000 to 3,700,000

Finishing Cost
This includes tiles, windows, doors, kitchen, paint, woodwork, wardrobes, and other interior details. On average:
- PKR 3,000,000 to 4,000,000

Total Estimated Cost (5 Marla)
- PKR 6,200,000 to 7,700,000

The final cost varies depending on material selection and design complexity.

3. Cost to Build a 10 Marla House in Multan (Updated)

A 10 Marla home typically has 3,300 to 3,800 square feet of covered area. Here is the cost analysis:

Grey Structure Cost
- PKR 5,800,000 to 6,800,000

Finishing Cost
- PKR 4,500,000 to 6,500,000

Total Estimated Cost (10 Marla)
- PKR 10,300,000 to 13,300,000

The cost mainly depends on tile quality, wood type, door selection, kitchen accessories, and electrical fittings.

4. Cost to Build a 1 Kanal House in Multan (Updated)

A 1 Kanal house covers approximately 5,000 to 5,800 square feet. These are the updated cost estimates:

Grey Structure Cost
- PKR 10,000,000 to 12,000,000

Finishing Cost
- PKR 10,000,000 to 15,000,000

Total Estimated Cost (1 Kanal)
- PKR 20,000,000 to 27,000,000

The cost fluctuates based on premium finishes such as imported tiles, high-end wardrobes, branded sanitary fittings, and luxury kitchen accessories.

5. Why Construction Costs Differ in Different Areas of Multan

Construction costs vary between societies like DHA Multan, Citi Housing, Buch Villas, and earlier-developed areas. Factors include:
- Society restrictions and design requirements
- Soil condition and foundation needs
- Material availability near the site
- Water and electricity connection charges

Premium societies often require higher-quality finishes and stricter guidelines.

6. How ANU Architects Helps You Save Cost

ANU Architects optimizes your construction budget through:
- Efficient architectural design
- Minimizing material waste
- Smart planning for ventilation and lighting
- Accurate working drawings
- Structural integrity to avoid long-term repairs

With the right design, homeowners save significantly on utilities and construction waste.

Conclusion: Plan Smart, Build Smart

Building a home requires a clear understanding of materials, budgeting, labor, and design. With this updated cost guide for 5 Marla, 10 Marla, and 1 Kanal houses in Multan, you can plan your construction journey confidently. If you want detailed planning, drawings, or complete turnkey construction, ANU Architects is ready to guide you at every step.

title: Top 10 House Designs in Multan for 2025 – Trends by ANU Architects
excerpt: Discover the top 10 modern house design trends shaping Multan in 2025. From minimalist elevations to climate-responsive layouts, ANU Architects highlights the best design ideas that will define residential architecture this year.
content:
Introduction: House Design Trends Evolving in Multan

Multan is quickly becoming a hub for modern residential architecture. With new housing societies, improved construction standards, and a rising demand for aesthetic homes, 2025 brings fresh design trends that blend beauty, function, and comfort. At ANU Architects, our approach focuses on creating spaces that enhance lifestyle while remaining practical for Multan’s climate.

1. Minimalist Front Elevations

Minimalist designs continue to lead the architectural landscape in Multan. Clean lines, balanced proportions, and subtle color combinations create an elegant look. Materials like exposed concrete, natural stone, and matte finishes add a timeless appeal.

2. Large Windows and Natural Light Design

Homeowners in 2025 prefer spaces with abundant daylight. Large windows, skylights, and glass openings bring in natural light, reduce electricity consumption, and make the interior feel more open and spacious.

3. Open-Concept Living Spaces

Modern homeowners want fluid spaces that connect living, dining, and kitchen areas. Open-concept layouts increase family interaction, improve ventilation, and make the house feel bigger than its actual size.

4. Climate-Responsive Architecture for Multan

Multan’s extreme heat demands smart design decisions. In 2025, the focus is on:
- Strategic shading
- Cross ventilation
- Heat-resistant materials
- Insulated roofs
- Proper orientation of rooms

These choices dramatically reduce cooling costs and improve comfort.

5. Double-Height Spaces

Double-height lounges and entrance lobbies are becoming a top trend. They add luxury and create a powerful visual impact while improving airflow and natural lighting.

6. Multi-Purpose Rooms and Smart Space Planning

Instead of separate rooms for every function, modern homes now include flexible spaces such as:
- Home offices
- Study corners
- Entertainment rooms
- Indoor gyms

This trend aligns with modern lifestyles and work-from-home culture.

7. Nature-Integrated Interiors

Biophilic design is rising in Multan. Homeowners prefer:
- Indoor plants
- Wooden textures
- Courtyard gardens
- Wall-to-wall greenery

These elements soften interior spaces and improve air quality.

8. Modern Kitchen Designs

2025 kitchen trends emphasize both functionality and aesthetics. Popular features include:
- Island counters
- Built-in appliances
- Matte-finish cabinetry
- LED under-cabinet lighting
- Seamless storage solutions

These layouts make kitchens efficient and visually clean.

9. Smart Home Integration

Technology is becoming a core part of home design. Features such as automated lighting, app-controlled security, smart thermostats, and sensor-based appliances are increasingly common in new homes across Multan.

10. Elegant Exterior Lighting

Exterior lighting can transform the appearance of a house at night. Homeowners prefer warm, subtle lighting integrated into cladding, boundary walls, and landscape paths to create a luxurious nighttime ambience.

Why These Trends Work Best in Multan

Multan requires designs that balance aesthetics with practicality. These 2025 trends highlight durability, comfort, climate adaptability, and modern styling—all essential for long-term value in residential construction.

How ANU Architects Leads Design Innovation

At ANU Architects, we combine modern architectural principles with local climate needs. Our team focuses on functionality, structural accuracy, and designing spaces that truly enhance everyday living. Each home is customized to reflect the client’s lifestyle, ensuring a unique and personalized experience.

Conclusion: The Future of House Design in Multan

The top 10 house design trends for 2025 show a clear shift toward modern, practical, and sustainable living. Whether you are planning a 5 Marla, 10 Marla, or 1 Kanal home, these ideas will help you create a residence that feels elegant, comfortable, and future-ready. If you want expert guidance, ANU Architects is here to turn your dream home into reality with thoughtful design and professional execution.

Introduction: Choosing the Right Housing Society in Multan

Building a new home in Multan is a major investment, and selecting the right housing society is critical. Modern societies provide not just land but also security, infrastructure, and lifestyle amenities. With numerous options available, understanding which societies offer the best value, convenience, and long-term growth potential is essential for any homeowner.

1. DHA Multan

DHA Multan is one of the most prestigious housing societies in the city. Known for its planned layouts, wide roads, and modern amenities, DHA provides a secure and sophisticated environment for families.

Key features:
- Gated community with 24/7 security
- Parks and recreational areas
- High-quality infrastructure
- Easy access to schools, hospitals, and commercial areas

2. Citi Housing Multan

Citi Housing is a growing society popular for affordable plots and modern facilities. It attracts investors and homeowners looking for a balanced mix of price and quality.

Key features:
- Wide main roads and well-laid streets
- Electricity, water, and gas connections
- Commercial areas and mosques
- Green spaces and community parks

3. Buch Villas

Buch Villas is an upscale society offering modern residential plots with aesthetic planning. Its prime locations and quality construction standards make it a favorite for luxury homes.

Key features:
- Modern layout planning
- Gated and secure community
- Nearby commercial and educational facilities
- Landscaping and open spaces

4. Wapda Town Multan

Wapda Town is a long-established society with reliable infrastructure and community facilities. It’s suitable for homeowners seeking a balanced environment with established utilities.

Key features:
- Wide roads and proper drainage system
- Schools, hospitals, and shops nearby
- Community centers and parks

5. Smart City Multan

Smart City focuses on modern urban planning and technologically integrated living. It is ideal for tech-savvy homeowners looking for a futuristic lifestyle.

Key features:
- Smart infrastructure planning
- Eco-friendly and sustainable designs
- Integrated utilities and high-speed connectivity
- Recreational and commercial hubs

6. Royal Orchard Multan

Royal Orchard is known for its premium plots and gated environment. It attracts homeowners looking for luxurious and secure living with easy access to city centers.

Key features:

- Landscaped parks and recreational areas

Why These Societies Are Ideal for New Homes

These societies offer more than just land. They provide peace of mind, modern amenities, and long-term investment value. Proper planning, security, and community features make them ideal for families looking to build homes that are comfortable, functional, and future-ready.

Conclusion: Choose Wisely, Build Smart

Selecting the right housing society is the first step toward building a dream home in Multan. By considering amenities, security, infrastructure, and location, homeowners can make informed decisions. With professional design and guidance from ANU Architects, building your new home in these top societies becomes a seamless and rewarding experience.
